channel.title: Genetic Algorithm
channel.description:
So... I am struggling. I can't think of any legitimately easy-enough ideas for a genetic algorithm.
Please also suggest what the fitness and mutation functions would consist of if you suggest an idea.
Any help?
Thanks, Adam

item.title: Genetic Algorithm
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The canonical example is something for scheduling, so if you wanted something real-world applicable you could go for that. Also, stuff like the TSP is fun enough, though you might have seen enough of the TSP to last you a lifetime.

Also pretty cool to read for an actual use is http://lbrandy.com/blog/2010/11/using-genetic-algorithms-to-find-starcraft-2-build-orders/. It’s a SC2 build order finder. There’s debate over whether it could be considered genetic, but it’s evolutionary nonetheless and pretty neat unusual use.

Read full topic

item.title: Genetic Algorithm

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You could go simpler than sudoku and do a 9 puzzle or similar.

Read full topic

item.title: Genetic Algorithm
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

Sanskrit:

http://www.obitko.com/tutorials/genetic-algorithms/

I’m quite aware of what a genetic algorithm is. I’m asking for ideas on a project. @link: my professor used one of the programs on there as an example.

super_:

as i recall correctly c`p had written a small little virtual population simulator. it consisted of circles which had three traits: a message, a color, and a radius. it spawned the world randomly and it continued until they were all the same color or something of the sort. it was visual which made it interesting.

It does sound interesting. But it doesn’t really solve anything and that’s what I (personally) would like to do, is optimize something :rolleyes:

the bank:

System.out.println(“Hello World!”);

Should I mutate it to say, “Fuck off.” ? I don’t get it.

EDIT: I’ve decided to write a sudoku solver. Obviously a GA is not the best approach, but it works and will give me credit!
(Actually, this will probably take a fuck-load of generations to complete even a 9x9, but…)

Thanks

Read full topic
